thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL BOYS HOCKEY: Needham names Michael Hoban as new boys coach | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark | Boston Herald

author: Dan Ventura
title: HIGH SCHOOL BOYS HOCKEY: Needham names Michael Hoban as new boys coach | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
text:
In a press release from Needham High, Michael Hoban has been named the new boys hockey coach. He replaces Jamie O'Leary, who stepped down to take the athletic director's job at St. Joseph's in Brighton.
 Hoban played locally at St. Sebastianâ€™s and then went on to have an outstanding collegiate career at Babson College, where he was a two-time team MVP and served as captain during his senior season. Upon graduation, Hoban played professionally in the FHL and ECHL, before moving into the coaching ranks, where in addition to his Needham responsibilities, he has also c oached with the Greater Boston Junior Bruins and the Boston Brahmas.
